skillTree.localised_description: Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.

skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Towering mountains of muscle and flesh, these War Mammoths give Wulfrik's tribe the edge over all comers.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +20 for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Skin Wolves in the Wanderer's service enjoy speed and skill beyond even their preternatural capabilities.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Cursed to wander the length and breadth of the world, his never-ending quest to challenge and best the most gifted warriors.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Men as great as the beasts they bring down.

skillTree.localised_description: Cursed to seek the deadliest opponents to best and kill in single combat, Wulfrik must forever walk the world.

ui_effects.localised_text: Small, forward-moving area of effect
Strong vs multiple units

effects.description: Immune to all sea based attrition

skillTree.localised_description: Wulfriks Gift of Tongues means no-one can deny him a duel, but he still delights in crude invectives to break his enemies spirits.
Wulfrik once pursued the path of a great warrior king, and for a time cursed the gods for denying him.

skillTree.localised_description: Beware drunken boasts made in sight of the Dark Gods, lest they hold you to such claims

skillTree.localised_description: There's no outrunning the terrible, flying Longship known as the 'Seafang'; once in its sights, an agonising, merciless death is your only possible destination.

ui_effects.localised_text: Small, forward-moving area of effect
Strong vs multiple units

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, its not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This one is known among the coastal cities.
Bring it all back! The plunder halls and slave camps will overflow!
Pathetic. Try again.
We will level their cities and burn their fields.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The warhounds range far and wide to hunt for food and locate targets for their masters.

skillTree.localised_description: ...so then I grabbed him by the trunk and threw him into the bay. Remember that next time you feel like whining about the cold.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates  lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky  its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
Once Wulfrik has made his infernal offerings, the mangled gore that remains is devoured by his ravenous, insatiable Werekin.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Skin Wolf Werekin
	(own local province)
Hero capacity: +1 for Skin Wolf Werekin

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: The ability to irrefusably challenge anyone - or anything - in their native language ensures that Wulfrik's Ruinous quest will never end.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +1% per character rank for Lords
Free unit of Marauder Champions in every Wulfrik battle
Bonus vs large: +5 for Marauder Infantry units
Unique units: Huscarls (capacity per major settlement) and Ulfhednar (capacity per minor settlement)

items.colour_text: Although King Torgald's blade is a prized trophy, it is also an eternal reminder of the consequences of grand proclamations afore the Gods.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Born to slaughter in their Ruinous names, Wulfrik bears the Mark of the Dark Gods upon his flesh.
